title: Keycard: Unable to pass PIN entry screen in certain flows

milestone.description:
## Messaging & Communities team

**1.  Fix bug and stabilise Communities and Messaging functionality** 

**2.  Reduce size of community description metadata**
- better compressions, less duplication

**3. Use data sync layer (or other mechanism) to improve community description reliability**
- Every time a new user joins the community, the Control Node updates and signs the description.
- Random back off to stop it being too chatty 

**4. Continue work on profile showcase**

 

## Wallet Team

**1. Complete support for Community minted assets**

**2. Complete token visibility management screens**

**3. Continue working on WalletConnect support**

**4. Minor updates to Asset screens**

**5. Continue fixing bugs, making optimisations and keeping tech debt low**

body:
# Bug Report

## Description

There are Keycard-related flows where the user is unable to pass PIN entry screen despite entering correct PIN.

Flows affected:
1. Rename Keycard
2. Change PIN
3. Create backup copy
4. Create 12-digit code (PUK) 

## Steps to reproduce

1. Login to the app (at least one keycard account attached to the account)
5. Go to Settings -> Keycard
6. Click on the Keycard that has been added
7. Select any of the options (i.e. Rename Keycard, Change PIN, etc.)
8. Plug in the reader when asked
9. Insert the keycard when asked
10. Enter correct PIN

#### Expected behavior
PIN is recognized. User can continue.

#### Actual behavior
Nothing happens. User is unable to continue.

### Additional Information
This is happening only if the flow is started without reader connected. If the reader is connected (with card inside) before the start of the flow the PIN is recognized correctly.

Logs from the session: 
[app_20240125_003356.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/files/14045022/app_20240125_003356.log)


- Status desktop version:  
Windows: StatusIm-Desktop-240124-075601-8da684-nightly-x86_64
macOS: StatusIm-Desktop-240124-075601-8da684-nightly-aarch64
- Operating System: Windows 11 & macOS Sonoma
